content: Bad networking is overrated. Good networking is underrated. Unfortunately, many people don’t know what good networking looks like, so everything they associate with the word “networking” is bad, and that’s where you get statements like “networking is overrated.” For me, networking includes talking to people, making connections, building relationships, and everything else about interpersonal interaction. I would even go so far as to include one-way “interaction” as networking, that is, activities like reading books, listening to podcasts, and watching videos. The only way I could not network with others would be to live in the woods, with no contact to civilization or society.
